evals.prompt: Create a pull request for the new JWT authentication feature I just implemented. The changes add OAuth2 login support to the auth module - I modified src/auth/login.ts and src/auth/middleware.ts, and added tests in tests/auth.test.ts.
evals.expected_output: A GitHub PR with a conventional commit title like 'feat(auth): Add OAuth2 login support', proper PR body with Summary, Related Issues, and Checklist sections, and includes git push command.
expectations: The PR title follows the conventional commit format: type(scope): Summary
The PR title uses one of the valid types: feat, fix, perf, test, docs, refactor, build, ci, chore, or revert
The PR title summary starts with a capital letter
The PR title summary does not end with a period
The response includes a 'gh pr create' command
The PR body contains a Summary section
The PR body contains a Related Issues section
The PR body contains a Checklist section
The response includes or mentions a git push command

evals.prompt: I fixed a bug where the payment API was returning a 500 error on large file uploads (over 10MB). The fix is in api/payment.py where I added proper chunked upload handling. Please make a PR for this.
evals.expected_output: A GitHub PR with a title like 'fix(api): Resolve 500 error on large file uploads', proper PR body structure, and workflow steps.
expectations: The PR title starts with 'fix' type since this is a bug fix
The PR title follows the pattern type(scope): Summary
The PR title summary starts with a capital letter
The response includes a 'gh pr create' command with --title flag
The PR body includes a Summary section describing the fix
The PR body includes a Checklist with PR title format check

evals.prompt: I updated the README.md with better installation instructions and added API documentation to docs/api-reference.md. Create a pull request for these documentation changes.
evals.expected_output: A GitHub PR with a title like 'docs: Update README and add API reference documentation', using the 'docs' type.
expectations: The PR title uses 'docs' type since the changes are documentation only
The PR title follows the conventional commit format
The response checks git status or git diff as part of the workflow
The PR body includes a Summary section
The PR body contains a Checklist section
